Extraordinarily ambitious (Re)Startup Hell-bent on dominating the Procurement service needs of the Construction Building Materials Industry; one of our planet's Top-Four Hierarchical industries by human need (shelter).  We are deeply aware that by capturing a client base of even a meager 5% of our overall Industry, executing effectively on our Business Plan's outlined three-phased launch - our model(s) for monetization and delivering best-in-class service - thereby also, as you shall either experience or observe from a distance, creating an entire new category in the Construction industry, we understand that we are on the precipice of building a Billion-Dollar Business.We are actively seeking to align with partners who are the BEST in their Construction market specialties - which might well include YOUR Building Materials-related business, including Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Procurement, commercial-scale Order Fulfilment, large-volume business Creditors and Financial Services, or YOU personally.  As we aim squarely at the above-stated long-term opportunity of market cap growth for BuildingMaterials.com, our sights are set higher over a 10-year plan.  If you believe with confidence that you or your Building Materials business can contribute a meaningful and measurable impact on developing, shaping and growing BuildingMaterials.com to its unique intrinsic potential, please contact me.  If you are in a credible position to provide verifiably-proven C-level Executive mentoring, please contact me.As we prepare​ for Re-launch, please follow us on Twitter, using @BldingMaterials.  Please use either of the two email addresses below to contact us accordingly:My email:  kann@buildingmaterials.comALL partnerships:  partners@buildingmaterials.comPh:  (630) 880-KANNNotes:  1.  Please make the purpose of your email abundantly clear in the Subject line.2.  Kindly remember that this robust enterprise website is in Beta testing and therefore is not yet live.

Frequent donor to this exceptional organization, ASPCA, who does so incredibly much for so many animals in despair.  Not enough can be done to keep pace with the number of neglected and abused animals who in most cases are at the mercy of human behavior.  Still, I am impassioned that we must assemble all who will join the cause(s) that nurture, protect and save the lives of animals.Music legend Sir Paul McCartney says, "We can tell the most about a person's character by the way they treat animals".  I fully agree, and commit to doing all I can when I can.

PAWS Chicago is known to accept the largest number of animal rescues from natural disasters, providing expensive medical care, food nourishment, social attention, love, and play, as well as matching them with caring new adoptive pet parents.  PAWS Chicago is a very ambitious mission.  One that they do as well as anyone in the country or the world.  However, also one that requires charitable donations and volunteerism from empathic people.

summary: 26 years' Management of Design/Build, Construction, Building Materials Engineering and Leadership of many high-profile projects.  With formal education in Construction Technology & Engineering/Construction Management, my project experience includes being Director of Infrastructure for $300 million of the total $637 million "New Soldier Field" for the NFL's Chicago Bears, more than $85 million of additions and renovations to Chicago's renowned John G. Shedd Aquarium, Co-Management of Construction for the $20 million 'The Living Coast' exhibits, shop, restaurants, and banquet hall at Chicago's Brookfield Zoo.  Within a more than $200 million Program Management contract, managed new construction and modernizations/renovations of nine (9) schools in the Chicago Public School System.  As one of three Individuals selected to a team, was sent to perform, develop and present a complete "Best use of $200 million" 'Architectural/Engineering/Construction Needs Study' for the entire 90210 Beverly Hills, CA School District.  On the front end of AECOM's dual-government contract with the United States' and Great Britain's respective "National Science Foundations", developed the Master Project Schedule for our Design/Build of a super-futuristic structure in Antarctica from which both countries now work together and continue long-running research programs of the climate in Antarctica, as well as Solar System/Astronomy studies more easily done from the near-constant darkness and ideally-clear skies of Antarctica.  The building is occupied by American and British scientists who work in collaboration.  Managed design and construction of a $24 million movie theater in Chicago for Sony/Loews Cinemas, a YMCA for almost $7 million, and was Project Director on a massive and highly complex corporate campus-wide project for pharmaceutical giant Pfizer Inc.  These projects are mentioned as just some from a much longer project list. Please ask me for a complete list if you wish.
